CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 30, 1959, pg. 36, reads: "NAACP Radiothon - Dedicated to obtaining democracy in fact in this country, the local chapter of the NAACP and Radio Station WAMO last Saturday held a radiothon to appeal to the populace to enlist in fight for freedom by taking out NAACP memberships... The right photo shows that there was no shortage of volunteers for the radiothon. Some of the conscientious workers who handled telephones to receive pledges and perform other chores to make the program a success are, left to right: Miss Prudence Bethel, Miss Lois Suber, Mrs. Jane Tresville, Miss Helen Grace, Mrs. Gloria Mungin and Miss Mabel Adams.  Announcers Bill Powell and Sir Walter also volunteered their services. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Prudence Bethel, Lois Suber, Jane Tresville, Helen Grace, Gloria Mungin, and Mabel Adams, seated behind tables, with WAMO Radio Station disc jockeys Rev. Bill Powell holding microphone and John "Sir Walter" Christian standing on right, for NAACP Radiothon membership drive, in Centre Avenue YMCA
